<div class="esv"><h2>Genesis 10</h2>
<div class="esv-text"><h3 id="p01010001.01-1">Nations Descended from Noah</h3>
<p id="p01010001.05-1"><span class="chapter-num" id="v01010001-1">10:1&nbsp;</span>These are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.</p>
 <p class="chapter-first" id="p01010002.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v01010002-1">2&nbsp;</span>The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010003-1">3&nbsp;</span>The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010004-1">4&nbsp;</span>The sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010005-1">5&nbsp;</span>From these the coastland peoples spread in their lands, each with his own language, by their clans, in their nations.</p>
 <p id="p01010006.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v01010006-1">6&nbsp;</span>The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt, Put, and Canaan. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010007-1">7&nbsp;</span>The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010008-1">8&nbsp;</span>Cush fathered Nimrod; he was the first on earth to be a mighty man.<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f1" id="b1" title="Or 'he began to be a mighty man on the earth'">[1]</a></span> <span class="verse-num" id="v01010009-1">9&nbsp;</span>He was a mighty hunter before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>. Therefore it is said, &#8220;Like Nimrod a mighty hunter before the <span class="small-caps">Lord</span>.&#8221; <span class="verse-num" id="v01010010-1">10&nbsp;</span>The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010011-1">11&nbsp;</span>From that land he went into Assyria and built Nineveh, Rehoboth-Ir, Calah, and <span class="verse-num" id="v01010012-1">12&nbsp;</span>Resen between Nineveh and Calah; that is the great city. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010013-1">13&nbsp;</span>Egypt fathered Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010014-1">14&nbsp;</span>Pathrusim, Casluhim (from whom<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f2" id="b2" title="Or 'from where'">[2]</a></span> the Philistines came), and Caphtorim.</p>
 <p id="p01010015.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v01010015-1">15&nbsp;</span>Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn and Heth, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010016-1">16&nbsp;</span>and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010017-1">17&nbsp;</span>the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010018-1">18&nbsp;</span>the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the clans of the Canaanites dispersed. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010019-1">19&nbsp;</span>And the territory of the Canaanites extended from Sidon in the direction of Gerar as far as Gaza, and in the direction of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010020-1">20&nbsp;</span>These are the sons of Ham, by their clans, their languages, their lands, and their nations.</p>
 <p id="p01010021.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v01010021-1">21&nbsp;</span>To Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth, children were born. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010022-1">22&nbsp;</span>The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010023-1">23&nbsp;</span>The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010024-1">24&nbsp;</span>Arpachshad fathered Shelah; and Shelah fathered Eber. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010025-1">25&nbsp;</span>To Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg,<span class="footnote">&nbsp;<a href="#f3" id="b3" title="'Peleg' means 'division'">[3]</a></span> for in his days the earth was divided, and his brother's name was Joktan. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010026-1">26&nbsp;</span>Joktan fathered Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010027-1">27&nbsp;</span>Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010028-1">28&nbsp;</span>Obal, Abimael, Sheba, <span class="verse-num" id="v01010029-1">29&nbsp;</span>Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab; all these were the sons of Joktan. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010030-1">30&nbsp;</span>The territory in which they lived extended from Mesha in the direction of Sephar to the hill country of the east. <span class="verse-num" id="v01010031-1">31&nbsp;</span>These are the sons of Shem, by their clans, their languages, their lands, and their nations.</p>
 <p id="p01010032.01-1"><span class="verse-num" id="v01010032-1">32&nbsp;</span>These are the clans of the sons of Noah, according to their genealogies, in their nations, and from these the nations spread abroad on the earth after the flood.</p>
</div>
